thread.title: Couples opt for gun range romance at unique Valentine’s Day dating event
thread.title_full: Couples opt for gun range romance at unique Valentine’s Day dating event

author: Carlos Garcia
title: Couples opt for gun range romance at unique Valentine’s Day dating event
text:
Tweet 
Couples in Fort Worth, Texas looking for a unique way to celebrate St. Valentine’s day are heading to the gun range for a romantic rifle rendezvous. 
“Come to the gun range, shoot together, because couples that shoot together stay together,” says Taylor Lowery, the membership director of Defenders Outdoor Shooting Center. “What we offer here is something really different for couples. It’s a way for you to bond with each other.” 
CBS Dallas-Fort Worth reported that couples have been signing up for the unorthodox Valentine’s Day Date Night for weeks. 
“You’re always looking for something you can do together on Valentine’s Day that isn’t so overrated, isn’t so cheesy,” explained Lowery. 
“I would do anything other than a typical night out,” said Naomi Garcia. “It’s definitely not a cliché.” 
“You learn so much about the other person doing something totally out of the box,” says Hannah who goes shooting with her boyfriend every Valentine’s Day. “We’ve given each other ammo and stuff like that.” 
“If you don’t want to get her roses, get her a rifle,” Lowery concluded. 
The Valentine’s Day Date Night at the Defenders Shooting Center costs $45 per person and includes a gun rental, ammunition, hors d’oeuvres, and cocktails (after all the shooting is over). Rate this story
